November  

Feminist Pride Day was hosted by the Appalachian State University Womens Center on Oct PERIOD  with the theme Feminism is for Everybody held on Sanford Mall from  a.m PERIOD to  p.m PERIOD



Feminist Pride Day is an event to spread the message of what feminism really is trying to help people understand that its not about tearing down different people said Bevin Robinson a volunteer at the Womens Center PERIOD Its about making everyone equal. under the tent buttons were sold for  and Tshirts for  PERIOD The proceeds of the event benefit the Abigail Adams scholarship a scholarship that is awarded each year to a nontraditional female student PERIOD Approximately  was raised PERIOD

The scholarship is for women who might not be straight out of high school theyre older stuff like that Robinson said PERIOD

There was also information available to the public and an I heart feminism photo shoot PERIOD

Robinson said the purpose of the photo shoot gave people the opportunity to display why feminism is important to them PERIOD

Eli Farmer a firsttime Womens Center volunteer said he plans on volunteering with other events in the future PERIOD

As a male I can use my male privilege to benefit the womens movement Farmer said PERIOD At the base level all feminism is women wanting the same rights as men  whats wrong with that

Farmer said the stigma surrounding feminism that it is antimen is not true PERIOD

I think people get hung up on that but if people sit down and do maybe three seconds of research theyll realize thats not the case Farmer said PERIOD

Robinson said Feminist Pride Day is an important day to the Womens Center PERIOD

It helps to get our message out people will understand that were here to help everybody and were here for benefitting everybody Robinson said PERIOD Were here to help students who may not have the funds to come to school. story Nicole Caporaso News Reporter

Your donation will support the student journalists of The Appalachian at Appalachian State University PERIOD Your contribution will help us cover some of our operational costs and continue to provide professional development opportunities for our students at App State PERIOD Thank you for your support of local journalism

The Appalachian
